intro: Byttneria dielsii, commonly known as the African silk tree, is a member of the Malvaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters in height, characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats.
